fields.Title of Contribution: Leaving Necessity Entrepreneurship Behind: How entrepreneurs actualize desirable futures
fields.Description/Abstract: <p>Recent changes in how scholars conceptualize necessity entrepreneurship have rendered the traditional, dichotomous, push-pull framework, which delineates between necessity and opportunity entrepreneurs, obsolete. We know that some individuals transition out of necessity entrepreneurship – indeed, this is an important and desirable outcome given that necessity entrepreneurship underperforms other forms of entrepreneurship on most key metrics – but the push-pull framework offers no theoretical pathway to explain such a move. We build on recent reconceptualization of the opportunity construct to describe the process by which an entrepreneur’s underlying needs – basic, psychological, and self-fulfillment based – inform both the desired future state that they pursue, and their evaluation of the conditions necessary for them to take entrepreneurial action. In doing so we offer a process model that explains upward mobility among entrepreneurs, and suggest five outcomes to replace necessity and opportunity as entrepreneurial outcomes.</p>
